column4: i'm having a weird issue with DNS lookups: i can nslookup an address and it comes back with the right IP but I can't ping it - it just says the host is not found
what the heck is going on - nslookup can resolve it but ping/traceroute cant?
is there an entry for it in /etc/hosts?
workflow.local is the DNS server, so it should get resolved fine without needing to edit /etc/hosts?
pastebin the output of: dig workflow.local
whats the output of: host workflow.local
sounds like another case of the resolveconf daemon  screwing things up ..
it wasnt break if you have your resolv.conf right (static or dhcp)
do you happen to know the package name of resolveconfd?
apt cant find that package it seems
